longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa required.

Visa Issuance:
- Nationals of Panama can apply for a 28 day, single entry
  tourist e-visa at http://evisa.moip.gov.mm/index.aspx. A
  printed Visa Approval Letter must be presented upon arrival
  to immigration authorities. 
Minors:
- Minors holding own passports must present documents proving
  relationship with accompanying parent/legal guardian. 
Additional Information:
- A tourist visa is valid for a max. period of 28 days. A fine
  of USD 3.- per day overstayed can be paid upon departure.
Warning:
- Visitors not holding confirmed return/onward tickets could
  be refused entry
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
Warning:
- Nationals or permanent residents of Myanmar leaving for a
  country with risk of yellow fever transmission must hold a
  yellow fever vaccination certificate. 
Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P.
  falciparum, exists throughout the year in remote rural,
  hilly and forested areas as well as in some coastal areas in
  Rahkine State. No transmission in cities and urban areas.
  Human P. knowlesi infection reported. Recommended
  prevention: D.
